Shoreditch, London

Circa £25,000 per annum, depending on experience


Applications for this role have now closed

The Open Data Institute connects, equips and inspires people around the world to innovate with data.

The ODI advises governments and businesses around the world on how to solve problems and create opportunities using data. A key part of this mission is to help organisations discover that not all innovation needs to come from inside, and that connecting the right people with the right data can lead to exciting new results.

The Junior Consultant will work closely with the delivery team and others across the organisation to help to develop and deliver the ODI’s services to governments, startups and the private sector.

Your role will also involve supporting delivery across the services team’s work, as well as delivering consulting, research and communications products on specific projects.

Due to the international nature of our work, this position is likely to involve some travel.

Key responsibilities

Delivering projects for clients

  • Producing high-quality analytical and research work for clients and internal research products
  • Assisting with facilitation of meetings and workshops
  • Designing products to help solve problems for clients

Managing internal and client projects

  • Supporting project leaders to set up implementable plans to deliver projects
  • Keeping track of budgets, timelines and deliverables
  • Managing multiple project parts simultaneously

Supporting the delivery team

  • Providing support for the leadership of the ODI’s delivery team to ensure its effective functioning, including by: maintaining excellent internal and external relationships; supporting team meetings and development; and preparing briefings before travel, conferences and client meetings

You must have the skills, knowledge, experience that will enable you to:

  • Manage your time to contribute to a range of projects across different parts of the team
  • Quickly get up to speed on a variety of different subjects
  • Work effectively and professionally with both corporate and government clients
  • Work well in a team environment, including showing calm and good judgement during periods of pressure and project uncertainty
  • Flexibly support the needs of clients and colleagues
  • Produce excellent research and written work

An academic background that helps you to understand the needs of government and/or businesses is desirable, as is work experience.

Applications for this role have now closed
